intro: Haloragis brownii, commonly known as the New Zealand starfruit, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. Haloragis brownii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
